MUTES EXECUTED:

My name is Erik Varner. I'm 34. I live in Columbus. In 2021, during a family Zoom call, my ex-girlfriend muted me. Not metaphorically. She clicked the button. My mouth kept moving and nobody heard a thing and nobody said anything about it. I watched myself talk to no one for eleven seconds before I realized what had happened.

I spent two years thinking about those eleven seconds.

Ghosting is violence done quietly. Every app on your phone has a mute button, a block button, an archive button. They made disappearing someone a feature. They made it frictionless. They made it so easy that we forgot it's supposed to hurt.

So I built a service that makes it hurt on purpose. Not for the person being muted — for you, the person doing it. You pay money. You upload their photo. You watch a real human being look you in the eye through a webcam and execute the disconnection you were too comfortable doing silently.

AssureCorrect doesn't make rejection easier. It makes it honest.
